intro: Senecio krapovickasii, commonly known as the Krapovickas's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small yellow flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
